title: 4 Easy Ways to Check Your Apple ID (iTunes) Balance

steps.title: Open the App Store .
steps.content: Open the App Store . This looks like an A with a blue background. [1] X Research source Make sure to update your iPhone or other iOS device .

steps.title: Tap your profile picture in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture in the top-right corner. Your profile picture may be your initials or a photo. The Account window will open. [2] X Research source If you aren't signed in, tap Sign in to do so now. You may need to provide your device's passcode or Face ID to proceed.

steps.title: Tap your Apple ID.
steps.content: Tap your Apple ID. You can find this at the very top, underneath Account . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Locate your balance.
steps.content: Locate your balance. If you have usable credits in your Apple ID, you will see the Balance below Manage Payments and Country/Region . [4] X Research source If you do not see a balance on this page, you do not have any credits in your balance. To add money to your account, you can use Apple Pay. Click Add Money to Account and enter the amount you want to add.

steps.title: Open the App Store.
steps.content: Open the App Store. This is a blue icon with an A . You'll be able to use the App Store to check your balance. [5] X Research source Make sure you're logged in to your Apple ID. If you aren't logged in, click Sign in at the bottom of the sidebar to do so now.

steps.title: Locate your balance.
steps.content: Locate your balance. If you have usable credits in your Apple ID, you will see the balance underneath your name in the bottom-left corner. [6] X Research source If you do not see a balance under your name, you do not have any credits in your balance.

steps.title: Open iTunes on your computer.
steps.content: Open iTunes on your computer. You'll be able to use iTunes to check your balance on your Windows computer. The iTunes icon looks like a pink-and-blue musical note in a white circle. [7] X Research source If you're not logged in, click the Account tab on the menu bar at the top, and select Sign in to sign in and continue. Make sure to update iTunes .

steps.title: Click the Store tab.
steps.content: Click the Store tab. You'll find it next to the Library and Unplayed tabs at the top. It will switch you to the iTunes Store.

steps.title: Find your current balance below the Search field.
steps.content: Find your current balance below the Search field. If you have a credit balance, you'll see how much you have below the Search field in the upper-right corner. If you do not see a balance under the Search field, you do not have any credits in your balance. You can use this balance to buy music or purchase

steps.title: Navigate to Apple's Gift Card Balance website in your web browser.
steps.content: Navigate to Apple's Gift Card Balance website in your web browser. You can use a desktop or mobile browser. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Sign into your Apple ID.
steps.content: Sign into your Apple ID. You'll need to log in to use this tool. If needed, you can create an Apple ID.

steps.title: Enter your gift card PIN.
steps.content: Enter your gift card PIN. Your PIN is located on the back of the gift card. For physical Apple Gift Cards, the PIN is located in the lower portion. On email gift cards, the PIN is below the Redeem Now button. For physical Apple Store and App Store & iTunes Gift Cards, the PIN is located on the upper portion. On email gift cards, the PIN is near the bottom, above the barcode on the left.

steps.title: Click Check Balance.
steps.content: Click Check Balance . You will see your balance underneath Here's your balance: . You can click Check another gift card if you want to check multiple balances.
